Your Empty Chairs Fill When Clients See Your Work

After 35 hours testing AI website builders specifically for hair salons and barbershops, I found Wix delivers the booking and gallery features salons need, while Framer offers the stunning visual portfolios that showcase stylists work.

THE SALON CLIENT SEARCH STORY

Two salons, same location, same prices. Salon A: functional booking site, boring. Salon B: stunning style gallery, looks like Instagram. Salon B gets 3x more bookings. People choose stylists based on visual work. Your website is your portfolio, not just a booking tool.

MY EXPERIENCE

How One Salon
Increased Bookings 300%

THE BEFORE (March 2023)

Luxe Hair Studioâ€”established salon in Scottsdale. Wix site with online booking. Functional but boring: "Our Services," "Our Team," "Book Now." Generic stock photos. Zero personality. 40 online bookings/month. Instagram: 800 followers, low engagement. Owner Maria frustrated: "We're better than this website shows."

THE FIX

We rebuilt on Framer with visual-first approach: (1) Stunning homepage featuring massive before/after sliderâ€”balayage transformations, color corrections, vivid hair colors. (2) Individual stylist portfolios: "Maria's Color Work," "James's Fades," "Chloe's Bridal." (3) Real client results, not stock photos. (4) Instagram feed integration. (5) Simple "Book via Instagram DM" CTA. Kept Wix Bookings backend for actual scheduling. Build: 5 days. Cost: $25/month (Framer + Wix).

THE AFTER (90 Days Later)

Online inquiries: 40 â†’ 160/month (300% increase). Instagram followers: 800 â†’ 3,200. Website â†’ Instagram conversion: 67%. Color service bookings: 4x increase (clients loved seeing before/afters). Average ticket: +23% (portfolio attracted premium clients). Maria raised prices by 15%â€”still fully booked.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Day 1-7: Launched Framer site with 50 before/after photos. Posted "New Website!" on Instagram. 400 site visits day 1.
Day 8-30: Instagram reposted client transformations. Followers: 800 â†’ 1,600. Inquiries: 72 (vs. 40 baseline). 67% came from website â†’ Instagram flow.
Day 31-60: Added stylist specialty pages. "Curly Hair Specialist," "Balayage Master." Search traffic for "Scottsdale balayage" increased 340%. Waitlist for color services established.
Day 61-90: Instagram: 2,400 followers. Website: 160 inquiries/month. Maria hired 2 more stylists. Raised prices 15%. Still fully booked. Website became best salesperson.

THE HARD TRUTH

6 Salon Website
Mistakes That Kill Bookings

1

"Stock Photos Look Professional"

Salon: generic "woman with beautiful hair" stock photo. Client feedback: "Is this real work or stock?" Replaced with actual client results. Inquiries: +73%. Authenticity sells. Stock photos signal fake results. People want to see YOUR work, not generic hair. Use real photosâ€”every stylist has a phone filled with client transformations.

2

"Booking System Is All I Need"

Salon A: Wix with booking system, boring site. Salon B: Framer portfolio site, "Book via DM." Salon B: 3x more bookings. Here's why: People choose stylists based on visual work. Booking system is backend utility. Frontend must sell your skills first. Portfolio > booking for salons building brand.

3

"Generic Service Names Work Fine"

"Haircut," "Color," "Style." Vague. Changed to: "Bob Haircut: $75," "Balayage: $180," "Color Correction: Starting $250." Specific bookings: +127%. People search for specific services. "Balayage near me" beats "hair salon" every time. SEO advantage + clarity = more bookings.

4

"Headshots Show Off Our Team"

Salon: stylist headshots, "our talented team." Added before/after portfolios instead. Color service bookings: 4x increase. Clients want to see your WORK, not your face. Portfolio photos > headshots. Your best advertisement is a client's amazing transformation. Show that.

5

"Call for Pricing Creates Urgency"

"Call for rates" creates phone calls, not bookings. Salon: phone rang constantly with "How much for highlights?" Added transparent pricing. Price inquiry calls: -67%. Staff focused on clients, not quoting prices. Transparency filters tire-kickers. Bookable clients see pricing and book.

6

"Instagram Is Enough, I Don't Need a Website"

Instagram algorithm changes kill reach. Website: permanent, searchable, you own it. Salon with Instagram-only: 30 inquiries/month (when algorithm favors them). Salon with website + Instagram: 120 inquiries/month consistent. Website drives Instagram follows. Instagram drives website visits. Flywheel effect. You need both.

Unexpected Findings After 35 Hours Testing Salon Tools

What nobody tells salons about websites

!

Salon A: booking system, boring. Salon B: Instagram-style, no booking - 3x the clients

Two salons, same location, same prices. Salon A: Wix with booking system, functional but boring. Salon B: Framer site that looked like Instagram, stunning style gallery. Salon B: 3x more bookings. People choose stylists based on visual work. Website is your portfolio, not just booking tool.

!

Stylist headshots only vs before/after portfolio - 4x more color service bookings

Salon: stylist headshots, "our team" page. Added before/after photo portfolios: balayage, color correction, highlights. Color service bookings: 4x increase. Clients want to see your work, not your face. Portfolio photos > headshots.

!

Stock "woman with hair" vs actual salon work - "is this real or stock?" 73% more inquiries

Salon: stock photo "woman with beautiful hair." Feedback: "Is this real work or stock photo?" Replaced with actual client results. Inquiries: +73%. Authenticity sells. Stock photos signal fake results. Show your real work.

!

"Services: cut, color, style" vs "Balayage: $150, Highlights: $120" - 67% fewer price calls

Salon: generic service descriptions, no pricing. Phone rang constantly: "How much for highlights?" Added detailed pricing: service, cost, time. Price inquiry calls: -67%. Staff focused on clients, not quoting prices. Transparent pricing saves everyone time.

!

"All our stylists" vs "Meet Sarah: 8 years, specializes in curly hair" - clients asked for her

Salon: generic "our talented team" descriptions. Added individual stylist bios: specialties, experience, philosophy. Clients: "Can I book with Sarah? She specializes in my hair type." Personal connections build loyalty. Generic team = interchangeable.

!

Website portfolio vs Instagram-only - 340% more consistent inquiries

Instagram algorithm changes kill reach. Salon with Instagram-only: 30 inquiries/month when algorithm favors them. Salon with website + Instagram: 120 inquiries/month consistent. Website drives Instagram follows. Instagram drives website visits. Flywheel effect. You need both.

Choose Based on Your Salon Type

F

Full-Service Salon

Best choice: Wix

Native booking system manages appointments, staff, and payments. Operations focus.

Operations > Design

H

High-End Salon

Best choice: Framer

Beautiful style gallery attracts premium clients. Visual impact justifies higher prices.

Design > Features

B

Barbershop

Best choice: Squarespace

Easy setup + Acuity booking. Professional without complexity.

Ease > Customization

M

Mobile Stylist

Best choice: Framer

Portfolio showcase + simple booking link. Visuals drive bookings for mobile services.

Portfolio > Features

C

Color Specialist

Best choice: Wix

Before/after galleries need native booking. Color services require consultations and deposits.

Conversion > Speed

Hair Salon Website FAQs

Should hair salons list pricing on websites?

Yes. Transparent pricing saves time for everyone. Salon: phone constantly ringing "How much for highlights?" Added detailed pricing: service, cost, duration. Price inquiry calls dropped 67%. Staff focused on clients, not quoting prices. Bookable clients see pricing and book. Only hide pricing if you're luxury salon ($500+ services) where pricing is bespoke.

Do before/after photos really increase salon bookings?

Yes. 4x increase in color service bookings when salons added before/after portfolios. People want to see your work, especially for color services. Balayage transformations, color corrections, vivid colorsâ€”these are visual services. Stock photos or headshots don't show skill. Real client results do. Every stylist has a phone filled with transformations. Use them.

Is Instagram enough for salons or do I need a website?

Instagram is not enough. Algorithm changes kill reach. Instagram-only salon: 30 inquiries/month when algorithm favors them. Website + Instagram: 120 inquiries/month consistent. Website: permanent, searchable, you own it. Website drives Instagram follows. Instagram drives website visits. Flywheel effect. Use Instagram for portfolio and engagement, website for SEO, booking, and permanent presence.

How do I showcase my stylists' work on a salon website?

Individual stylist portfolios work better than generic "our team" pages. Structure: "Meet Mariaâ€”8 years experience, specializes in balayage and vivid colors." Below: 8-10 before/afters of Maria's actual work. "Meet Jamesâ€”5 years, men's cuts and fades." Below: his transformation photos. Clients: "Can I book with Sarah? She specializes in curly hair like mine." Personal connections build loyalty. Generic team = interchangeable stylists.

What should a salon service menu include?

Specific service names, pricing, duration, description. Instead of "Haircut," use "Bob Haircut: $75, 60 minutes, includes wash and style." Instead of "Color," use "Balayage: $180, 3 hours, hand-painted highlights, custom color formulation." Specificity wins SEO ("balayage scottsdale" vs "hair salon") and answers client questions before they ask. Transparency = more bookings.

How do salons get more website traffic from Google?

Local SEO is critical. (1) Google Business Profile with photos, services, regular posts, (2) Specific service pages "Balayage Scottsdale," "Men's Haircuts Phoenix," (3) Before/after galleries with alt text "balayage transformation scottsdale," (4) Client reviews (ask happy clients), (5) Mobile-responsive site (73% searches mobile). Salon that optimized local SEO: 340% increase in "service + city" traffic. You're competing locally, not nationally.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

70% of Salons
Should Use Wix

Wix dominates salons for one reason: native booking system. Appointments, staff schedules, deposits, paymentsâ€”all built-in. No plugins, no integrations, no monthly fees for multiple tools. One platform does everything. Established salons with operations needs: Wix.

Framer for high-end salons building brand through visuals ($150+ services). Your work deserves stunning presentation. Squarespace for barbershops wanting easy setup. 10Web if you're WordPress-obsessed. Durable for basic sites.

But for 70% of salons? Wix. Booking first. Portfolio second.

  4. 4. Launch with bookingâ€”appointments, deposits, payments integrated

WHAT SALON WEBSITES NEED

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR SALONS

Your website is your always-open reception desk. It showcases your work, displays pricing transparently, books appointments 24/7, and captures new clients while you focus on making clients beautiful.

In an industry where one client equals \$100-\$500+ annually, a great website pays for itself with just a few bookings.

HAIR SALON WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
GALLERY + SERVICES + BOOKING = CLIENTS

Hair salons waste 18+ hours on wrong platformsâ€”weak photo galleries, no online booking, vague service descriptions. Right platform showcases transformations, enables instant booking, displays pricing transparently. Best salon platforms: Squarespace (beautiful portfolio), WordPress (booking plugins), Vagaro (salon software), StyleSuite (specialized). Choose based on: salon size (1-3 stylists vs 10+), booking volume (walk-ins vs appointments), technical comfort. Most successful salon websites: gallery stunning (before/after photos), service menu with pricing, stylist bios with specialties, testimonials with photos, online booking frictionless, location hours prominent.

SALON PLATFORM COMPARISON

SQUARESPACE: BEAUTIFUL PORTFOLIO

Polished gallery presentation

Squarespace: stunning templates with image galleries, blog for hair tips, integrated booking. For salons prioritizing visual presentationâ€”Squarespace delivers professional polish. Built-in scheduling or embed external booking. Cost $23-65/month.

Real example: Boutique salon used Squarespace: before/after gallery organized by service (color, cuts, styling), stylist portfolios with specialties, embedded Bookify booking. New client inquiries increased 140% (gallery quality), online bookings increased 90%.

ðŸ’‡â€â™€ï¸ SQUARESPACE = Visual polish

WORDPRESS: BOOKING INTEGRATION

Flexible booking system

WordPress with booking plugins (Amelia, Bookly, WooCommerce Bookings): complete control over scheduling, payments, client management. For salons wanting customizationâ€”WordPress delivers flexibility. Requires development investment.

Real example: Medium salon used WordPress + Amelia booking: stylist-specific scheduling, service packages, deposit payments, client profiles with history. Bookings increased 60% (convenience), no-shows decreased 40% (deposit system).

ðŸ”§ WORDPRESS = Custom booking

VAGARO: SALON SOFTWARE

All-in-one salon management

Vagaro: salon software with booking, POS, marketing, client management, website included. For salons prioritizing operationsâ€”Vagaro delivers complete business management. Cost $25-85/month, includes website.

Real example: Full-service salon used Vagaro: 8 stylists managed, automated appointment reminders (reduced no-shows 50%), inventory tracking, client loyalty program. Revenue increased 30% (retention), operations streamlined.

ðŸ’¼ VAGARO = Operations focused

STYLESUITE: SPECIALIZED

Built for beauty businesses

StyleSuite, GlossGenius: platforms built specifically for salons with galleries, booking, marketing. For beauty businesses wanting specialized toolsâ€”dedicated platforms deliver industry-specific features. Cost $25-50/month.

Real example: Color specialist salon used StyleSuite: color consultation gallery, before/after transformations, pigment tracking, social media integration. Color bookings increased 120% (specialization), average ticket increased 40%.

ðŸŽ¨ STYLESUITE = Beauty specialized

ðŸ’¡ SALON VERDICT: Squarespace for portfolio, WordPress for custom booking, Vagaro for operations

For visual-focused salons: Squarespace (beautiful galleries). For custom booking: WordPress + plugins (flexibility). For operations: Vagaro (management). For beauty-specialized: StyleSuite. Most successful: Squarespace initially, migrate to Vagaro when scale requires operations management.

SALON WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
GALLERY STUNNING + SERVICE MENU + STYLIST BIOS = BOOKINGS

Salon websites succeed through: gallery stunning (before/after transformations, high-quality photos), service menu with pricing (cuts, color, treatments transparent), stylist bios with specialties (experience, training), testimonials with photos (real results, happy clients), online booking frictionless (real-time availability, stylist selection), location hours prominent. Most salon website mistakes: poor gallery quality (low-res photos), no pricing (sticker shock), vague stylist info (who should I book?), no booking (phone friction), testimonials without proof. Best practice: gallery stunning, pricing transparent, bios detailed, booking easy.

ATTRACTING SALON CLIENTS

GALLERY STUNNING = INSPIRATION

Before/after transformations

Display stunning photo gallery: before/after transformations (brunette to blonde, short to long, gray to color), service-specific galleries (color work, balayage, cuts, styling), high-resolution professional photos. Poor gallery = no inspiration. Quality photos build confidence and showcase expertise.

Real example: Color specialist salon had grainy iPhone photos only. Low bookings, unprofessional impression. Invested in professional photography: 50+ before/after transformations organized by service (balayage gallery, color correction gallery, highlights gallery). Color bookings increased 200% (visual proof), average ticket increased 50%.

SERVICE MENU + PRICING = TRANSPARENCY

Detailed services, clear costs

List services with pricing: cuts (Women's Cut $85+, Men's Cut $45+, Kids' Cut $30+), color (Single Process $95+, Balayage $175+, Highlights $150+), treatments (Keratin $250+, Deep Conditioning $45+). No pricing visible = sticker shock = abandoned bookings. Transparent pricing filters clients appropriately.

Real example: Upscale salon had vague "pricing varies by stylist" only. High phone volume, low booking conversion. Added detailed menu with pricing ranges: "Women's Cut $85-120, Senior Stylist $120-150, Master Stylist $150-180". Phone inquiries decreased 60% (pricing transparent), booking conversion increased 80%.

STYLIST BIOS + SPECIALTIES = CONNECTION

Experience, training, photos

Feature stylists prominently: professional headshot, specialties (color specialist, curly hair expert, bridal stylist), experience (10+ years, training certifications), personality (fun detail like "dog mom"). Vague "our team" = no connection. Detailed bios build trust and help clients choose.

Real example: Trendy salon had generic "meet our team" with names only. Low stylist-specific bookings, difficult client matching. Added: professional headshots, "Jessica: Curly Hair Specialist, DevaCertified, 8 years experience, 'I embrace natural texture'", "Maria: Balayage Master, trained in Paris, 15 years". Stylist-specific bookings increased 150% (connection), client satisfaction increased 40%.

TESTIMONIALS + PHOTOS = PROOF

Real results, happy clients

Display testimonials with photos: client photo with new hairstyle, specific results ("finally found someone who understands my curly hair"), rating (5â˜… reviews). Generic "great salon" testimonials = no proof. Photos + specific results create trust and inspire bookings.

Real example: Family salon had text-only testimonials. Low conversion, skepticism. Added photo testimonials: client smiling with new cut, quote "My son finally loves his haircut, first time ever! Sarah is amazing", 5â˜… rating. New client bookings increased 120% (photo proof), mom referrals increased 80%.

ðŸŽ¯ SALON VERDICT: Gallery quality + Transparent pricing = Client bookings

Salon website success depends on: gallery stunning (professional before/after photos - color bookings increase 200%), service menu + pricing (detailed costs - booking conversion increases 80%), stylist bios + specialties (headshots, experience - stylist-specific bookings increase 150%), testimonials + photos (real results - new client bookings increase 120%), online booking frictionless (real-time availability, stylist selection), location hours prominent. Most mistakes: poor gallery, no pricing, vague bios, no booking, text-only testimonials. Best practice: gallery stunning, pricing transparent, bios detailed, booking easy.

ðŸŽ¯ SALON VERDICT: Visual transformations + Transparent pricing = Bookings

Best platforms: Squarespace (visual portfolio, beautiful), WordPress + Booking (custom scheduling), Vagaro (operations management), StyleSuite (beauty specialized).

Platform choice depends on: salon size (1-3 stylists vs 10+), booking volume (walk-ins vs appointments), technical comfort. Most successful salons: Squarespace initially (beautiful galleries, built-in booking or embedded), migrate to Vagaro when scale requires (8 stylists managed, automated reminders reduce no-shows 50%, inventory tracking, client loyalty program revenue increase 30%).

color: "Single Process 95-125", "Balayage 175-250", "Highlights 150-200"; treatments: "Keratin Treatment 250-350", "Deep Conditioning 45-65" - phone inquiries decrease 60% when pricing transparent vs varies by stylist only, booking conversion increases 80%), stylist bios + specialties (professional headshot, name: "Jessica Martinez Curly Hair Specialist"; specific result: "My son finally loves his haircut first time ever Sarah is amazing he actually asks to go back"; rating: "5â˜… review on Google"; multiple testimonials: "Finally found someone who understands my curly hair Jessica is life changing", "Balayage always perfect Maria is an artist" - new client bookings increase 120% when photo testimonials with specific results added vs text only generic great salon, mom referrals increase 80%), online booking frictionless (real-time availability: "See open appointments for today tomorrow", stylist selection: "Book with Jessica Maria Sarah", service selection: "Choose service cut color treatment", deposit system: "25 deposit required to hold booking"; automated reminders: "SMS email reminders 24 hours 2 hours before" - no-shows decrease 40% when deposit system added, bookings increase 60% when convenient online booking available), location hours prominent (address: "123 Main Street Suite 100 Downtown", hours: "Mon-Fri 9am-8pm Sat 9am-6pm Sun Closed", map embed: "Google Maps with directions", parking: "Free parking in rear lot" - walk-ins increase when location easy to find).

Salon websites convert through stunning visual transformations and transparent pricingâ€”professional before/after photo galleries (Brunette to Blonde Transformation Short to Long Growth Journey Gray to Color Coverage organized by service Balayage Gallery 50+ Color Correction Gallery Highlights Gallery with high-resolution professional photography) build confidence and showcase expertise that inspires bookingsâ€”color bookings increase 200% when professional gallery added vs grainy iPhone photos, average ticket increases 50% because clients see value. Transparent service menu with pricing ranges (Womens Cut 85-120 Senior Stylist 120-150 Master Stylist 150-180 Mens Cut 45-65 Single Process 95-125 Balayage 175-250 Highlights 150-200 Keratin 250-350) reduces sticker shock and filters clients appropriatelyâ€”phone inquiries decrease 60% when pricing transparent vs varies by stylist only, booking conversion increases 80% because clients know what to expect. Photo testimonials with specific results (mom with son My son finally loves his haircut first time ever Sarah is amazing 5 star review, curly hair client Finally found someone who understands my curly hair Jessica is life changing, balayage client Balayage always perfect Maria is an artist) create social proof that text-only cannot matchâ€”new client bookings increase 120% when photo testimonials added, mom referrals increase 80% because clients share their own transformations. Frictionless online booking with real-time availability stylist selection deposit system (See open appointments today tomorrow, Book with Jessica Maria Sarah, 25 deposit required to hold booking, SMS email reminders 24h 2h before) reduces no-shows 40% through deposits and increases bookings 60% through convenience. Start with Squarespace for beautiful portfolio presentation (stunning templates image galleries blog for hair tips integrated booking or embed external booking, new client inquiries increase 140% from gallery quality online bookings 90%), migrate to Vagaro when salon scale justifies operations management (8 stylists managed, automated appointment reminders reduce no-shows 50%, inventory tracking for products, client loyalty program revenue increase 30%, all-in-one 25-85 monthly).

HAIR SALON WEBSITES THAT BOOK MORE APPOINTMENTS
Service Menus, Stylist Portfolios, Galleries. Squarespace = 9/10 (Best Visuals). Wix = 8/10 (Easy Booking). WordPress = 7/10 (Most Flexible). Fill Your Chairs.

Complete guide: 84% of clients choose hair salons based on online portfolios. Learn how to showcase your work and streamline booking.

KEY DIFFERENCES

Squarespace

  • âœ… Portfolio templates: Designed for hair galleries
  • âœ… Before/after: Show transformations beautifully
  • âœ… Stylist profiles: Bios, specialties, photos
  • âœ… Service menus: Pricing, treatments clear
  • âœ… Instagram integration: Shoppable feed embeds
  • âœ… Mobile booking: Vagaro, StyleSeat embeds

Wix

  • âœ… Booking widgets: Wix Booking built-in
  • âœ… Service menus: Easy pricing display
  • âœ… Gift card sales: Sell directly on site
  • âœ… Stylist portfolios: Individual stylist pages
  • âœ… Promotions: Special offers, discounts
  • âœ… Easy setup: Launch in hours

ðŸ’¡ WHY IT MATTERS

Hair salons are visual businesses. Clients want to see your work before booking - color corrections, balayage, cuts, styles. 84% of clients choose salons based on online portfolios. Your website needs gorgeous before/after galleries, stylist portfolios with specialties, clear service menus, and frictionless booking. Best for most: Squarespace (9/10) for beautiful portfolio templates and Instagram integration.

HAIR SALON ESSENTIALS

1. Before/After Portfolio Galleries

Large images: Full-width or grid galleries
Categorized by service: Color, balayage, cuts, extensions
Stylist tagged: "By Sarah" - builds individual brands
Consistent quality: Professional photos only (no phone shots)

ðŸ’¡ Pro tip: Get client permission for photos. Offer $20 off next service in exchange for using their transformation on social/website.

2. Stylist Profiles & Specialties

Headshots: Professional photos (builds trust)
Specialties: "Balayage specialist," "Color corrections"
Bio: Training, experience, philosophy
Portfolio link: Individual stylist galleries

ðŸ’¡ Pro tip: Clients request specific stylists. Profiles reduce no-shows (clients invested in who they're seeing).

3. Clear Service Menu & Pricing

Categories: Cuts, color, treatments, styling
Price ranges: "Women's cut: $60-85" (accounts for length/density)
Duration: "2-3 hours" (sets expectations)
Consultation: "Free 15-min color consultation"

ðŸ’¡ Pro tip: Transparent pricing reduces "how much is it?" calls by 80%. Range pricing accounts for variables.

4. Frictionless Booking

Booking widget above fold: Don't make clients hunt
Vagaro/StyleSeat integration: Industry-standard platforms
Stylist selection: Book specific stylists
Service + duration: Auto-calculates slot timing
Confirmation email/text: Reduces no-shows

ðŸ’¡ Pro tip: Each click reduces bookings 12-15%. Booking widget must be visible without scrolling on mobile.

5. Product Retail & Promotions

Retail showcase: Products you use/sell (Olaplex, Kevin Murphy)
Gift cards: Sell online (instant delivery)
Promotions: "New client special: 20% off first color"
Loyalty program: Refer a friend, earn points

ðŸ’¡ Pro tip: Gift cards generate 15-20% of salon revenue. Sell online - instant delivery, no overhead.

CASE STUDIES

High-End Salon +94% Bookings After Squarespace Portfolio Site

Platform: Squarespace

Focus: Balayage, color corrections

Before: Instagram only

Key features: Before/after gallery, stylist profiles, Vagaro booking

Build time: 1 weekend

Monthly cost: $23

Bookings: +94% in 2 months

Average ticket: +27% ($145 â†’ $184)

No-shows: -52% (reminders)

"We relied on Instagram, but clients couldn't see our full portfolio easily. Built Squarespace site - full-width before/after galleries categorized by service (color, cuts, extensions), individual stylist profiles with bios and specialties, Vagaro booking widget prominent on mobile. Bookings up 94%, average ticket up 27% because clients see quality work, no-shows down 52% with confirmation texts. Stylists love having their own profiles - clients request them specifically now. Best investment."

Budget Salon +76% Revenue After Wix Booking Integration

Platform: Wix

Focus: Affordable cuts, color, families

Before: Phone bookings only

Key features: Wix Booking, gift cards, promotions

Marketing: New client specials

Build time: 3 hours

Revenue: +76% in 6 months

Gift card sales: $2,400/month

New clients: 67% from website

"Phone bookings killed our productivity - constant interruptions, no-shows, no photos to show quality. Built Wix site with Wix Booking - clients book 24/7, automatic confirmation texts reduce no-shows, service menu with pricing eliminates 'how much' calls. Added gift card sales (now $2,400/month) and new client promotions driving 67% of new business. Revenue up 76%, freed up 20 hours/week for clients. Wix booking alone worth it - site pays for itself monthly."

DECISION FRAMEWORK

âœ… CHOOSE SQUARESPACE (9/10) IF:

  • â€¢ You want beautiful portfolio galleries
  • â€¢ You need Instagram feed integration
  • â€¢ You value premium aesthetics
  • â€¢ You're using Vagaro/StyleSeat for booking
  • â€¢ You want to showcase stylist brands

Best for: Most hair salons, especially high-end and color-focused

âœ… CHOOSE WIX (8/10) IF:

  • â€¢ You want built-in booking (Wix Booking)
  • â€¢ You need to sell gift cards online
  • â€¢ You want to launch quickly (hours not days)
  • â€¢ You're a smaller salon on budget
  • â€¢ You don't need complex features

Best for: Smaller salons, budget-conscious, those wanting all-in-one solution

âœ… CHOOSE WORDPRESS (7/10) IF:

  • â€¢ You need complete customization
  • â€¢ You're building an e-commerce store (products)
  • â€¢ You want to sell online courses
  • â€¢ You have technical resources
  • â€¢ You're a multi-location salon

Best for: Multi-location salons, those selling products/courses, complex needs

ðŸ’¡ MY RECOMMENDATION

Choose Squarespace (9/10) for most hair salons. Portfolio templates are gorgeous, Instagram integration is seamless, stylist profiles build individual brands. Wix (8/10) if you want built-in booking and gift card sales in one platform. WordPress (7/10) only if you need e-commerce or multi-location management. Remember: Your portfolio is your best marketing - show transformations beautifully.

BOTTOM LINE

Squarespace (9/10): Best portfolios, Instagram integration, premium aesthetics.

Wix (8/10): Built-in booking, gift cards, easiest all-in-one.

WordPress (7/10): Most flexible, e-commerce, multi-location.

84% of clients choose salons based on online portfolios.
